Description: Red ware pottery goblet with cream slip decoration on the upper part of the body and with two closely spaced concentric horizontal grooves around the carination.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), X-5 Room 1 Level 2
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p48)
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
